image.altText: Aerial view of an airbase with a runway surrounded by trees.

props.synopsis: Locals are alarmed that Chinese men dropped on a remote beach were able to enter an Australian air base undetected, given the ramping up of surveillance along the crocodile-infested coastline.

title.children: Despite increased surveillance, Chinese men walked onto a northern Australian airstrip

image.altText: A crowd of people walking along a street in a central business district in Melbourne on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: Inflation has come in higher than expected during the March quarter, dampening expectations of interest rate cuts by the later in the year.

title.children: Inflation rises more than expected, with prices increasing by 3.6 per cent in last year

image.altText: Donald Trump sits in court next to his lawyer Todd Blanche

props.synopsis: A former newspaper publisher outlines how he bought and buried negative stories about Donald Trump, and the former president's lawyer is chastised by a judge, as the "hush money" criminal trial continues in New York.

title.children: 'You're losing all credibility,' judge tells Trump's lawyer, and other key moments from the 'hush money' trial

image.altText: Arj Barker speaks into a microphone while standing on stage in front of purple backdrop

props.synopsis: It really should come as no surprise to Arj Barker that the eviction of a breastfeeding mother from his Melbourne show has whipped up another round of culture wars, but these situations are complicated by differing experiences and emotional triggers — and culture wars aren't good with detail.

title.children: Australia's culture wars are back on the topic of breasts. It's no great surprise, but perhaps this time there's a lesson

image.altText: Hand holding money, notes and coins with a coffee cup and fruit in the background, cost of living

props.synopsis: Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Inflation data shows prices still rising but increase slowing

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Inflation is +3.6% for the year to March
Milk strike! (But it won't stop your flat white)
US bans 'non-compete' clauses - are we next?

image.altText: woman smiles at camera standing inkitchen with stairs leading up to her left

props.synopsis: Coby Koster found her way out of the rental market by purchasing a tiny home but says planning hiccups among local governments are holding other people back.

title.children: Councils explore cutting red tape for tiny homes with big planning requirements

image.altText: A floral tribute at the scene for Hannah McGuire at the site where her remains were found.

props.synopsis: Childcare worker and mother Molly Ticehurst was found dead in a regional New South Wales home on Monday morning. The Forbes local was 28 years old. And, she was the 25th woman to die from gender-based violence in Australia this year.

title.children: Samantha Murphy was 13th, Hannah McGuire the 18th: The violent deaths of women this year is a 'crisis'

image.altText: Summer Van Andel and Gabrielle Taylor sit at a table inside their home.

props.synopsis: Summer Van Andel and her younger brother were sitting on their couch when a toy car powered by a lithium-ion battery exploded while on charge in December last year.  It's just one of more than 1,000 fires caused by the batteries in Australia in 2023.

title.children: Gabrielle estimates a battery explosion in her home caused $8,000 damage — and no-one is paying compensation

image.altText: An aerial view of an outback community.

props.synopsis: The Department of Energy, Mines, Industry Regulation and Safety has confirmed the fatal incident occurred yesterday and investigators are at the scene.

title.children: Investigation underway after man dies at WA mine site

image.altText: Prince William and Princess Catherine attend a ceremony. Catherine is wearing a large red hat.

props.synopsis: The Prince and Princess of Wales thank the public for messages marking the sixth birthday of their youngest son Louis, who beams at the camera in a portrait taken by his mother.

title.children: Prince William and Princess Kate release first family photo taken by Kate since photoshop controversy

image.altText: Trainer Darren Weir with horse Prince of Penzance in 2015.

props.synopsis: The champion horse trainer has been cleared of allegations that he used a jigger on racehorses with the intention of corrupting the outcome of the 2018 Melbourne Cup.

title.children: Darren Weir cleared of allegations he intended to corrupt the outcome of the 2018 Melbourne Cup

image.altText: Composite image of Brittany Higgins and Defence Minister Linda Reynolds

props.synopsis: Senator Linda Reynolds sues her former political staffer Brittany Higgins and Ms Higgins's partner David Sharaz for defamation over a series of social media posts — and neither side appears willing to back down.

title.children: While all eyes have been on the failed Bruce Lehrmann defamation case, another legal drama is playing out in WA

image.altText: Jim Chalmers holds a thick book with a dark blue cover which a lighter blue Southern Cross titled Budget 2023-24

props.synopsis: If you are looking for the truth, flip your way to about page 87 of the main budget document, where the government must make clear what it is doing and why.

title.children: Looking for the real story behind the budget? Turn to about page 87 and everything will become clear

props.synopsis: The social media platform X is expected to return to the Federal Court today to argue why it should not have to hide footage of the Wakeley stabbing.

title.children: Musk's X says Australia's take-down call was 'overreach'. Here's how the case could play out in court today

image.altText: A police car parked out the front of a single-storey suburban house.

props.synopsis: Homicide squad detectives have arrested a 39-year-old man believed to be known to a 49-year-old woman found deceased in a home in Cobram yesterday afternoon.

title.children: Homicide squad investigating death of woman in northern Victoria

image.altText: A group of women go for a run

props.synopsis: When women pick out a sports bra they're probably not thinking of their knees, but surprising new research shows there's a link between breast support and serious knee injuries.

title.children: The bra you exercise in could be putting you at greater risk of an ACL tear

image.altText: A production line of solar panels at Sunman Energy

props.synopsis: Twenty years ago China built a solar manufacturing industry on the back of Australian innovation. Now, as Australia tries to build a solar industry of its own, it needs assistance from China.

title.children: 'Sun King' says Australia can build its own solar panel industry, with a little help from China

image.altText: Tom Wodak

props.synopsis: A retired judge who made key immigration decisions for the Australian government has excoriated Labor's "appalling" deportation bill as morally and legally suspect.

title.children: 'What they're doing stinks': Former top immigration official slams government deportation bill

image.altText: A young woman and her dog sit next to each other on a beach.

props.synopsis: Police say compelling information has been uncovered as a group of five country officers bring a renewed focus to giving Seaford woman Marcia Ryan's family the answers they have been seeking since 1996.

title.children: Marcia Ryan disappeared 28 years ago. Now police are reopening their investigation

image.altText: A wombat sits in shallow water along a beach.

props.synopsis: A couple holidaying in Tasmania's remote north-west have captured a wombat foraging in the ocean. The footage has surprised wombat experts, who say the behaviour is highly unusual.

title.children: Experts left scratching their heads as wombat wanders into ocean

image.altText: a small bay of water under blue skies with rocks at the bottom of the frame

props.synopsis: The mysterious appearance of a sandy beach at a bay in Sydney's east has caused intrigue for decades, and after a series of large swells it is gone once again.

title.children: Beach days are over for lovers of ephemeral Sydney swimming spot after sand disappears in stormy weather

image.altText: A boy with a blurry face holds a phone, the light illuminating his face against the darkened background.

props.synopsis: Sam was shocked to discover her son had been badgering a peer for nudes. Teen educator Bec Sparrow and clinic psychologist Dr Sophie Li had some advice for her.

title.children: Sam found out her son had hassled a girl for nudes, but she wasn't sure what to do next

image.altText: A police helicopter in hangar.

props.synopsis: Far North Queensland will receive a dedicated police helicopter to fight crime from the sky as the state government announces an ambitious plan to boost the front line with 900 new officers.

title.children: New police chopper for Cairns as Queensland government announces plans to recruit 900 extra cops

image.altText: Turquoise water in a cave lake with two explorers - one is on a kayak.

props.synopsis: The Nullarbor Plain is famous for being dry, flat and featureless — but it's a very different story beneath the surface, with an intricate cave system that has remained mostly untouched.

title.children: A subterranean wonderland lies beneath the Nullarbor. A battle between energy and the environment looms in its future

image.altText: Two men in matching outfits walk closely together along a dirt track, jungle visible on either side.

props.synopsis: As Anthony Albanese and James Marape continue an unprecedented joint trek up and down the mountains and valleys, they walk with a shared purpose: to acknowledge their history, to embody the friendship of two nations and to promote peace in the region.

title.children: Albanese and PNG PM walk, talk and catch a breath together, as they climb Kokoda Track

image.altText: A profile image of a woman with long, ice blonde hair. She has a slight smile on her face.

props.synopsis: Premier Chris Minns says he has requested that Attorney-General Michael Daley review the circumstances leading up to the alleged murder this week.

title.children: NSW premier flags domestic violence-related bail laws review in wake of Molly Ticehurst's alleged murder

image.altText: A large crowd of people holding up signs in front of a university building

props.synopsis: Student protests in the US over the war in Gaza intensify and expand, with a number of encampments now in place at colleges including Columbia, Yale, and New York University.

title.children: Pro-Palestine protests spread across US colleges, with students arrested at Yale, NYU and Columbia

image.altText: Workers in forensic overalls examine a row of shrouded corpses.

props.synopsis: Several mass graves are being exhumed in the ruins of the Nasser and Al-Shifa medical facilities in Khan Younis, Gaza, with reports some of the bodies have their hands tied.

title.children: UN rights chief horrified by reports of mass graves at destroyed Nasser, Al-Shifa hospitals in Gaza

image.altText: Emily Sun wearing a black evening dress posing with "The Adelaide" violin.

props.synopsis: Australian violinist Emily Sun has become the custodian of "The Adelaide", a violin purchased by the people of South Australia in 1955, currently valued at $US1 million.

title.children: 'Like a marriage': What it’s like playing one of the world's rarest violins

image.altText: An artist's impression of the Voyager spacecraft in space

props.synopsis: Humanity's most distant spacecraft — which fell silent in November — is once again sending status reports after NASA engineers working with a two-day communication delay devised a software fix for a failed computer chip.

title.children: NASA sends software update 24 billion kilometres to restore communication with Voyager 1

image.altText: A render of a new hospital.

props.synopsis: The Catholic Church is taking the Victorian government to VCAT seeking an extra $8.5 million dollars over the acquisition of land at Melton. The government acquired the land from the church to build a major new public hospital.

title.children: In one of the fastest-growing areas of Australia, a church dispute has thrown a spanner in the works for a new hospital

image.altText: A man in a hat and sunglasses holds a feral goldfish

props.synopsis: Some of the world's largest feral goldfish have been found in a river flowing through a popular WA tourist town. Now, the dumped pets are being removed.

title.children: Dumped goldfish grow into hefty ferals, but their days in this murky river paradise are numbered

image.altText: Batter Marcus Stoinis shouts as he runs, carrying his bat and helmet in his hands during an IPL game.

props.synopsis: Australian all-rounder Marcus Stoinis reaches three figures for the first time in nine IPL seasons, smashing 19 off the last over to get his Super Giants home.

title.children: Marcus Stoinis breaks IPL century drought, smashing Super Giants to victory in another run-fest

image.altText: A young girl stares just beyond the camera, wearing a blue snow jacket and matching beanie. Her hands are in yellow gloves.

props.synopsis: Drive My Car director Ryusuke Hamaguchi follows his Oscar-winning film with the story of a glamping site development in a rural Japanese village.

title.children: This Japanese film is 'one of the most deceptively beautiful movies of the year so far'

image.altText: The PM speaking next to the AFP commissioner Reece Kershaw and ASIO boss Mike Burgess

props.synopsis: Social media companies are slammed by Australia's top police officer for "pouring accelerant on the flames" of misinformation and extremism on their platforms, while the boss of ASIO raises concerns encrypted chat services are a "safe room for terrorists and spies".

title.children: Top cop and spy boss urge social media companies to do better on encryption
